column5: I pose the question "Has there ever been poetry on WC?". I offer up the late Canadian poet Al Purdy....http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VSzNqbgk50Y
A bather whose clothing was strewed, By winds that left her quite nude, Saw a man come along, And unless we are wrong, You expected this line to be lewd.

Nimstug....that was short, and to the point.....with a surprise ending! Very nice, do you have more? Seems WC is not a very poetic crowd. What about the "Lord of Script....REW"? Surely he can chime in on this topic...........
None that would prevent the thread from being dusted...

Check out some poetry by Robert W Service. His personal story is pretty interesting as well. Here's an excerpt from "The Men That Don't Fit In", which is something of a statement of Service's own life experiences. He left a job as a banker and traveled to western Canada and the Yukon to live an outdoor life. There's A race of men that don't fit in, A race that can't stay still; So they break the hearts of kith and kin, And they roam the world at will.
